articles.content: LONDON: England all-rounder Chris Woakes has revealed that he pulled out of this year's IPL primarily to be with his pregnant wife but need not have officially announced his withdrawal from the event, which was suspended indefinitely due to the coronavirus pa… [+2606 chars]

articles.title: India Today League PUBG MOBILE Invitational match reports: SouL top Day 1 despite losing Chicken Dinner - India Today
articles.description: All four match reports of India Today League PUBG Mobile Invitational: Team Soul finished on top with 61 points followed by TSM Entity with 52 points (27 kill pts, 25 position pts), Fnatic (49 pts), Celtz (43 pts) and Powerhouse (43 pts).
articles.content:
Team SouL topped the standings after 4 matches on Day 1 of the India Today League PUBG Mobile Invitational tournament without even winning a single Chicken Dinner on Thursday.
SouL finished with 61 points with 31 kill points and 30 position points. TSM Entit… [+3232 chars]

articles.title: “I Needed To Win It” – Stan Wawrinka On Beating Novak Djokovic At The Australian Open - Essentially Sports
articles.description: Recently, Stan Wawrinka had a chat with Chris Evert where he talked about his win at the 2014 Australian Open. Check out what he said.
articles.content: 2014 was just another year for most of us but not for Stan Wawrinka. 2014 was the year he won his first grand slam at the Australian Open and became a major figure on the ATP tour. He recently talked about his victory there with Chris Evert. Check out what he… [+1360 chars]

articles.title: ‘Had stuffed up for RCB two years ago’: Shane Watson recalls redemptive ton for CSK in 2018 final - Hindustan Times
articles.description: CSK, who were banned from the tournament for two years after a corruption scandal, were returning to the franchise, and were vying for the title.
articles.content: Former Australia batsman Shane Watson on Thursday recalled his match-winning century for Chennai Super Kings in the Indian Premier League 2018 final. CSK, who were making a return to IPL after completing a two-year ban were vying to win the title. After winni… [+1895 chars]

articles.title: Shikhar Dhawan plays Quarantine Premier League with son Zoravar at home; watch video - Republic World - Republic World
articles.description: Shikhar Dhawan would be vital to the Delhi Capitals' top order during IPL 2020. The fate of the tournament is now unknown as the India lockdown continues.
articles.content: If normal circumstances persisted at present, Shikhar Dhawan would be travelling around with the Delhi Capitals on the team's quest for its first-ever IPL trophy. But the circumstances today are far from normal as the coronavirus pandemic is tightening its gr… [+1882 chars]

articles.title: India's batting was more powerful than ours on paper, but they played for themselves: Inzamam-ul-Haq - India Today
articles.description: Inzamam-ul-Haq claimed that Indian batsmen scored hundreds but played mainly for themselves whereas Pakistani batters scored every run for the team whenever they played together.
articles.content:
Former Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq believes that Indian batsmen he played against scored hundreds for themselves instead of the team while the players from his side were exactly the opposite.
Inzamam was speaking to Ramiz Raja on his Youtube channel, lis… [+1286 chars]

articles.title: This day, 7 years ago: Chris Gayle hits fastest hundred in cricket history during IPL - India Today
articles.description: During IPL 2013, Chris Gayle slammed 66-ball 175 that included 17 sixes and 13 boundaries which took RCB to a record-breaking 263/5 in 20 overs against Pune Warriors.
articles.content: On April 23, 2013, Chris Gayle broke the record for the fastest hundred in the history of cricket with his 30-ball hundred during the IPL clash between Royal Challengers Bangalore and Pune Warriors. The West Indian remained unbeaten on 175 that still holds th… [+1313 chars]

articles.author: Bangkok Post Public Company Limited
articles.title: Players back Federer over tennis merger as Kyrgios hits out - Bangkok Post
articles.description: PARIS - WTA founder Billie Jean King and Rafael Nadal led a wave of support on Thursday for Roger Federer's suggestion that "now is the time" to merge the men's and women's governing bodies, while tennis is at a standstill because of the coronavirus pandemic.
